Articles.Content:
One thing that's been bugging me for some time is the part glow. I'm not talking about the green hue when hovering over a part with your mouse rather the red heat glow.

I don't mind glowing engine nozzles and radiators, those only add to the realism. What I want to get rid of is the ugly glow on entire wings and or cockpits. Those are not only very unrealistic they look absolutely horrible.

> 
> One thing that's been bugging me for some time is the part glow. I'm not talking about the green hue when hovering over a part with your mouse rather the red heat glow.
> I don't mind glowing engine nozzles and radiators, those only add to the realism. What I want to get rid of is the ugly glow on entire wings and or cockpits. Those are not only very unrealistic they look absolutely horrible.

I use [HeatWarning](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/116773-1-0-HeatWarning/) and it seems to disable the eye-gouging glow you're talking about and also replaces the stock temperature gauges with something that's arguably better.

EDIT: Why is the thread's rating one star? Guys, this isn't reddit, don't give something a bad rating just because you disagree with it. Be honest, the heat glow they added is incredibly rushed and an eyesore.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-11T23:44:53Z" title="08/11/2015 11:44  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 11, 2015</time> by mythbusters844**
I'll look into that. But if I can't disable that horrendous sound warning I'd rather go with the heat glow. That sound warning is worse.

I've tried HeatWarning and found it lacking. It does not do what I was looking for. It does not remove any of the hideous part glow, the sound warning is awful and it actually heats up certain parts faster than stock.

Any other suggestions are more than welcome but HeatWarning is out the door.

It should be optional. I think it's quite nice for the right application.

[http://i.imgur.com/UpBmA3L.gifv](http://imgur.com/UpBmA3L)
I support this, it should be optional and off by default like all the other overlays.
